revised_title: Electromagnetic Rotation of Light in Bisulphide of Carbon
tldr: The author, Lord Rayleigh, conducted experiments to determine the constant of electromagnetic rotation of light in bisulphide of carbon. They used a helix and a tube of bisulphide of carbon to measure the rotation of light and compared their results with previous findings by Gordon and Becquerel. The study aimed to improve current measurement methods and understand the behavior of light in different conditions.
